SENT.plain: Immortalization of B lymphocytes by Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) is complex and poorly understood
However, some evidence suggests that glucocorticoids influence this process
We identified a glucocorticoid-responsive element in the BamHI C fragment of EBV which we call ES-1

In glucocorticoid-treated cells, ES-1 enhanced chloramphenicol acetyltransferase gene expression from the herpes simplex virus thymidine kinase promoter, as well as the EBV Bam-C promoter, from which several latent viral gene products are transcribed
By Northern blot analysis, glucocorticoid treatment enhanced transcription from the Bam-C promoter in Jijoye cells, a Burkitt's lymphoma cell line
In addition, the DNA-binding domain of the glucocorticoid receptor bound specifically to the ES-1 region
These glucocorticoid effects on the Bam-C promoter region may provide some insight into the process of EBV immortalization
